abTesting.pageSubtitle: Scientific approach to view growth without guessing

problem.text: Most creators choose thumbnails intuitively. "I like this one" â€” and hope. Sometimes they guess right, usually not.

solution.text: A/B test â€” you upload 2-3 variants, YouTube shows them to different viewers and after 12-72 hours says: "This one gets 34% more engagement".

proof.lead: Even the world's most popular creator MrBeast doesn't guess. He uploads multiple variants and looks at the data.
proof.impact: Small detail? That's millions of views difference.
proof.unlock1: This feature used to be only for top creators.
proof.unlock2: Now it's available to everyone. And I know how to use it.

result.text:
That's thousands of extra viewers from EVERY video.
Without changing content.

faq.pageSubtitle: Everything you need to know before ordering
faq.q1: What is A/B testing on YouTube?
faq.a1: YouTube allows uploading multiple thumbnail variants for one video. The platform automatically shows different variants to viewers and collects CTR data. After a few days, the algorithm picks the winner â€” the thumbnail with the best conversion. This lets you make decisions based on data, not guesses.
faq.q2: How long does one thumbnail take?
faq.a2: Standard delivery is 24-48 hours. Rush orders are discussed individually and completed in 4-12 hours. With ongoing collaboration, timelines can be even shorter.
faq.q3: How much does a thumbnail cost?
faq.a3: Price depends on complexity and volume. Basic thumbnail starts at $29. A/B variant package starts at $39. Regular clients get special rates. Message on Telegram for a quote for your project.
faq.a4: This is standard practice for creative services. Prepayment ensures commitment and allows immediate start. If you're not satisfied â€” I'll revise until you are or refund your money.
faq.q5: What if I don't like the thumbnail?
faq.a5: Revision rounds are included. I work until you're fully satisfied. If for any reason you're unhappy after all revisions â€” full refund.
faq.q6: Do you work with English-speaking channels?
faq.a6: Yes, over 60% of clients are English-speaking channels. I work with all languages and understand different market specifics.
faq.q7: What materials do you need from me?
faq.a7: Minimum â€” video topic and desired style. Ideally â€” references you like, photos for the thumbnail (if needed), and info about your target audience.
